segment.source: How to Enable BitLocker by Using MBAM as Part of a Windows Deployment
segment.target: How to Enable BitLocker by Using MBAM as Part of a Windows Deployment

segment.source: How to Enable BitLocker by Using MBAM as Part of a Windows Deployment
segment.target: How to Enable BitLocker by Using MBAM as Part of a Windows Deployment

segment.source: How to Enable BitLocker by Using MBAM as Part of a Windows Deployment
segment.target: How to Enable BitLocker by Using MBAM as Part of a Windows Deployment

segment.source: This topic explains how to enable BitLocker on an end user's computer by using MBAM as part of your Windows imaging and deployment process.
segment.target: This topic explains how to enable BitLocker on an end user's computer by using MBAM as part of your Windows imaging and deployment process.

segment.source: An existing Windows image deployment process – Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager, or some other imaging tool or process – must be in place
segment.target: An existing Windows image deployment process – Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager, or some other imaging tool or process – must be in place

segment.source: TPM must be enabled in the BIOS and visible to the OS
segment.target: TPM must be enabled in the BIOS and visible to the OS

segment.source: MBAM server infrastructure must be in place and accessible
segment.target: MBAM server infrastructure must be in place and accessible

segment.source: The system partition required by BitLocker must be created
segment.target: The system partition required by BitLocker must be created

segment.source: The machine must be domain joined during imaging before MBAM fully enables BitLocker
segment.target: The machine must be domain joined during imaging before MBAM fully enables BitLocker

segment.source: To enable BitLocker using MBAM 2.5 SP1 as part of a Windows deployment
segment.target: To enable BitLocker using MBAM 2.5 SP1 as part of a Windows deployment

segment.source: In MBAM 2.5 SP1, the recommended approach to enable BitLocker during a Windows Deployment is by using the PowerShell script.
segment.target: In MBAM 2.5 SP1, the recommended approach to enable BitLocker during a Windows Deployment is by using the PowerShell script.

segment.source: The script enacts BitLocker during the imaging process.
segment.target: The script enacts BitLocker during the imaging process.

segment.source: When required by BitLocker policy, the MBAM agent immediately prompts the domain user to create a PIN or password when the domain user first logs on after imaging.
segment.target: When required by BitLocker policy, the MBAM agent immediately prompts the domain user to create a PIN or password when the domain user first logs on after imaging.

segment.source: Easy to use with MDT, System Center Configuration Manager, or standalone imaging processes
segment.target: Easy to use with MDT, System Center Configuration Manager, or standalone imaging processes

segment.source: Encrypt OS volume with TPM key protector
segment.target: Encrypt OS volume with TPM key protector

segment.source: Escrow TPM OwnerAuth, even on Windows 8 or higher (MBAM still must own the TPM on Windows 7 for escrow to occur)
segment.target: Escrow TPM OwnerAuth, even on Windows 8 or higher (MBAM still must own the TPM on Windows 7 for escrow to occur)

segment.source: Escrow recovery keys and recovery key packages
segment.target: Escrow recovery keys and recovery key packages

segment.source: You can download the script from Microsoft.com Download Center.
segment.target: You can download the script from Microsoft.com Download Center.

segment.source: This is the main script that your deployment system will call to configure BitLocker drive encryption and record recovery keys with the MBAM Server.
segment.target: This is the main script that your deployment system will call to configure BitLocker drive encryption and record recovery keys with the MBAM Server.

segment.source: WMI deployment methods for MBAM: The following WMI methods have been added in MBAM 2.5 SP1 to support enabling BitLocker by using the PowerShell script.
segment.target: WMI deployment methods for MBAM: The following WMI methods have been added in MBAM 2.5 SP1 to support enabling BitLocker by using the PowerShell script.

segment.source: PrepareTpmAndEscrowOwnerAuth: Reads the TPM OwnerAuth and sends it to the MBAM recovery database by using the MBAM recovery service.
segment.target: PrepareTpmAndEscrowOwnerAuth: Reads the TPM OwnerAuth and sends it to the MBAM recovery database by using the MBAM recovery service.

segment.source: If the TPM is not owned and auto-provisioning is not on, it generates a TPM OwnerAuth and takes ownership.
segment.target: If the TPM is not owned and auto-provisioning is not on, it generates a TPM OwnerAuth and takes ownership.

segment.source: If it fails, an error code is returned for troubleshooting.
segment.target: If it fails, an error code is returned for troubleshooting.

segment.source: A string specifying the MBAM recovery service endpoint.
segment.target: A string specifying the MBAM recovery service endpoint.

segment.source: Here are a list of common error messages:
segment.target: Here are a list of common error messages:

segment.source: TPM is not present in the computer or is disabled in the BIOS configuration.
segment.target: TPM is not present in the computer or is disabled in the BIOS configuration.

segment.source: TPM is not in the correct state (enabled, activated and owner installation allowed).
segment.target: TPM is not in the correct state (enabled, activated and owner installation allowed).

segment.source: MBAM cannot take ownership of TPM because auto-provisioning is pending.
segment.target: MBAM cannot take ownership of TPM because auto-provisioning is pending.

segment.source: Try again after auto-provisioning is completed.
segment.target: Try again after auto-provisioning is completed.

segment.source: MBAM cannot read the TPM owner authorization value.
segment.target: MBAM cannot read the TPM owner authorization value.

segment.source: The value might have been removed after a successful escrow.
segment.target: The value might have been removed after a successful escrow.

segment.source: On Windows 7, MBAM cannot read the value if the TPM is owned by others.
segment.target: On Windows 7, MBAM cannot read the value if the TPM is owned by others.

segment.source: The computer must be restarted to set TPM to the correct state.
segment.target: The computer must be restarted to set TPM to the correct state.

segment.source: You might need to manually reboot the computer.
segment.target: You might need to manually reboot the computer.

segment.source: The computer must be shut down and turned back on to set TPM to the correct state.
segment.target: The computer must be shut down and turned back on to set TPM to the correct state.

segment.source: You might need to manually reboot the computer.
segment.target: You might need to manually reboot the computer.

segment.source: Access was denied by the remote endpoint.
segment.target: Access was denied by the remote endpoint.

segment.source: The remote endpoint does not exist or could not be located.
segment.target: The remote endpoint does not exist or could not be located.

segment.source: The remote endpoint could not process the request.
segment.target: The remote endpoint could not process the request.

segment.source: The remote endpoint was not reachable.
segment.target: The remote endpoint was not reachable.

segment.source: A message containing a fault was received from the remote endpoint.
segment.target: A message containing a fault was received from the remote endpoint.

segment.source: Make sure you are connecting to the correct service endpoint.
segment.target: Make sure you are connecting to the correct service endpoint.

segment.source: The endpoint address URL is not valid.
segment.target: The endpoint address URL is not valid.

segment.source: The URL must start with “http” or “https”.
segment.target: The URL must start with “http” or “https”.

segment.source: ReportStatus: Reads the compliance status of the volume and sends it to the MBAM compliance status database by using the MBAM status reporting service.
segment.target: ReportStatus: Reads the compliance status of the volume and sends it to the MBAM compliance status database by using the MBAM status reporting service.

segment.source: The status includes cipher strength, protector type, protector state and encryption state.
segment.target: The status includes cipher strength, protector type, protector state and encryption state.

segment.source: If it fails, an error code is returned for troubleshooting.
segment.target: If it fails, an error code is returned for troubleshooting.

segment.source: A string specifying the MBAM status reporting service endpoint.
segment.target: A string specifying the MBAM status reporting service endpoint.

segment.source: Here are a list of common error messages:
segment.target: Here are a list of common error messages:

segment.source: Access was denied by the remote endpoint.
segment.target: Access was denied by the remote endpoint.

segment.source: The remote endpoint does not exist or could not be located.
segment.target: The remote endpoint does not exist or could not be located.

segment.source: The remote endpoint could not process the request.
segment.target: The remote endpoint could not process the request.

segment.source: The remote endpoint was not reachable.
segment.target: The remote endpoint was not reachable.

segment.source: A message containing a fault was received from the remote endpoint.
segment.target: A message containing a fault was received from the remote endpoint.

segment.source: Make sure you are connecting to the correct service endpoint.
segment.target: Make sure you are connecting to the correct service endpoint.

segment.source: The endpoint address URL is not valid.
segment.target: The endpoint address URL is not valid.

segment.source: The URL must start with “http” or “https”.
segment.target: The URL must start with “http” or “https”.

segment.source: EscrowRecoveryKey: Reads the recovery numerical password and key package of the volume and sends them to the MBAM recovery database by using the MBAM recovery service.
segment.target: EscrowRecoveryKey: Reads the recovery numerical password and key package of the volume and sends them to the MBAM recovery database by using the MBAM recovery service.

segment.source: If it fails, an error code is returned for troubleshooting.
segment.target: If it fails, an error code is returned for troubleshooting.

segment.source: A string specifying the MBAM recovery service endpoint.
segment.target: A string specifying the MBAM recovery service endpoint.

segment.source: Here are a list of common error messages:
segment.target: Here are a list of common error messages:

segment.source: A Numerical Password protector was not found for the volume.
segment.target: A Numerical Password protector was not found for the volume.

segment.source: Access was denied by the remote endpoint.
segment.target: Access was denied by the remote endpoint.

segment.source: The remote endpoint does not exist or could not be located.
segment.target: The remote endpoint does not exist or could not be located.

segment.source: The remote endpoint could not process the request.
segment.target: The remote endpoint could not process the request.

segment.source: The remote endpoint was not reachable.
segment.target: The remote endpoint was not reachable.

segment.source: A message containing a fault was received from the remote endpoint.
segment.target: A message containing a fault was received from the remote endpoint.

segment.source: Make sure you are connecting to the correct service endpoint.
segment.target: Make sure you are connecting to the correct service endpoint.

segment.source: The endpoint address URL is not valid.
segment.target: The endpoint address URL is not valid.

segment.source: The URL must start with “http” or “https”.
segment.target: The URL must start with “http” or “https”.

segment.source: Deploy MBAM by using Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) and PowerShell
segment.target: Deploy MBAM by using Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) and PowerShell

segment.source: In MDT, create a new deployment share or open an existing deployment share.
segment.target: In MDT, create a new deployment share or open an existing deployment share.

segment.source: The PowerShell script can be used with any imaging process or tool.
segment.target: The PowerShell script can be used with any imaging process or tool.

segment.source: This section shows how to integrate it by using MDT, but the steps are similar to integrating it with any other process or tool.
segment.target: This section shows how to integrate it by using MDT, but the steps are similar to integrating it with any other process or tool.

segment.source: If you are using BitLocker pre-provisioning (WinPE) and want to maintain the TPM owner authorization value, you must add the script in WinPE immediately before the installation reboots into the full operating system.
segment.target: If you are using BitLocker pre-provisioning (WinPE) and want to maintain the TPM owner authorization value, you must add the script in WinPE immediately before the installation reboots into the full operating system.

segment.source: If you do not use this script, you will lose the TPM owner authorization value on reboot.
segment.target: If you do not use this script, you will lose the TPM owner authorization value on reboot.

segment.source: If you are using pre-provisioning, copy the file into DeploymentShareScripts.
segment.target: If you are using pre-provisioning, copy the file into DeploymentShareScripts.

segment.source: Add the MBAM 2.5 SP1 client application to the Applications node in the deployment share.
segment.target: Add the MBAM 2.5 SP1 client application to the Applications node in the deployment share.

segment.source: Under the Applications node, click New Application.
segment.target: Under the Applications node, click New Application.

segment.source: In Application Name, type “MBAM 2.5 SP1 Client”.
segment.target: In Application Name, type “MBAM 2.5 SP1 Client”.

segment.source: Type “MBAM 2.5 SP1 Client” as the directory to create.
segment.target: Type “MBAM 2.5 SP1 Client” as the directory to create.

segment.source: Accept the remaining defaults to complete the New Application wizard.
segment.target: Accept the remaining defaults to complete the New Application wizard.

segment.source: In MDT, right-click the name of the deployment share and click Properties.
segment.target: In MDT, right-click the name of the deployment share and click Properties.

segment.source: Click OK to close the window.
segment.target: Click OK to close the window.

segment.source: Under the Task Sequences node, edit an existing task sequence used for Windows Deployment.
segment.target: Under the Task Sequences node, edit an existing task sequence used for Windows Deployment.

segment.source: If you want, you can create a new task sequence by right-clicking the Task Sequences node, selecting New Task Sequence, and completing the wizard.
segment.target: If you want, you can create a new task sequence by right-clicking the Task Sequences node, selecting New Task Sequence, and completing the wizard.

segment.source: On the Task Sequence tab of the selected task sequence, perform these steps:
segment.target: On the Task Sequence tab of the selected task sequence, perform these steps:

segment.source: Under the Preinstall folder, enable the optional task Enable BitLocker (Offline) if you want BitLocker enabled in WinPE, which encrypts used space only.
segment.target: Under the Preinstall folder, enable the optional task Enable BitLocker (Offline) if you want BitLocker enabled in WinPE, which encrypts used space only.

segment.source: To persist TPM OwnerAuth when using pre-provisioning, allowing MBAM to escrow it later, do the following:
segment.target: To persist TPM OwnerAuth when using pre-provisioning, allowing MBAM to escrow it later, do the following:

segment.source: Find the Install Operating System step
segment.target: Find the Install Operating System step

segment.source: Add a new Run Command Line step after it
segment.target: Add a new Run Command Line step after it

segment.source: Name the step Persist TPM OwnerAuth
segment.target: Name the step Persist TPM OwnerAuth

segment.source: In the State Restore folder, delete the Enable BitLocker task.
segment.target: In the State Restore folder, delete the Enable BitLocker task.

segment.source: In the State Restore folder under Custom Tasks, create a new Install Application task and name it Install MBAM Agent.
segment.target: In the State Restore folder under Custom Tasks, create a new Install Application task and name it Install MBAM Agent.

segment.source: Click the Install Single Application radio button and browse to the MBAM 2.5 SP1 client application created earlier.
segment.target: Click the Install Single Application radio button and browse to the MBAM 2.5 SP1 client application created earlier.

segment.source: In the State Restore folder under Custom Tasks, create a new Run PowerShell Script task (after the MBAM 2.5 SP1 Client application step) with the following settings (update the parameters as appropriate for your environment):
segment.target: In the State Restore folder under Custom Tasks, create a new Run PowerShell Script task (after the MBAM 2.5 SP1 Client application step) with the following settings (update the parameters as appropriate for your environment):

segment.source: Specify to encrypt data volume(s) and escrow data volume recovery key(s)
segment.target: Specify to encrypt data volume(s) and escrow data volume recovery key(s)

segment.source: Specify to wait for the encryption to complete
segment.target: Specify to wait for the encryption to complete

segment.source: Specify that the deployment script will not resume suspended encryption
segment.target: Specify that the deployment script will not resume suspended encryption

segment.source: Specify to ignore TPM owner-auth escrow failure.
segment.target: Specify to ignore TPM owner-auth escrow failure.

segment.source: It should be used in the scenarios where MBAM is not able to read the TPM owner-auth, e.g. if TPM auto provisioning is enabled
segment.target: It should be used in the scenarios where MBAM is not able to read the TPM owner-auth, e.g. if TPM auto provisioning is enabled

segment.source: Specify to ignore volume recovery key escrow failure
segment.target: Specify to ignore volume recovery key escrow failure

segment.source: Specify to ignore status reporting failure
segment.target: Specify to ignore status reporting failure

segment.source: To enable BitLocker using MBAM 2.5 or earlier as part of a Windows deployment
segment.target: To enable BitLocker using MBAM 2.5 or earlier as part of a Windows deployment

segment.source: For instructions, see How to Deploy the MBAM Client by Using a Command Line.
segment.target: For instructions, see How to Deploy the MBAM Client by Using a Command Line.

segment.source: Join the computer to a domain (recommended).
segment.target: Join the computer to a domain (recommended).

segment.source: If the computer is not joined to a domain, the recovery password is not stored in the MBAM Key Recovery service.
segment.target: If the computer is not joined to a domain, the recovery password is not stored in the MBAM Key Recovery service.

segment.source: By default, MBAM does not allow encryption to occur unless the recovery key can be stored.
segment.target: By default, MBAM does not allow encryption to occur unless the recovery key can be stored.

segment.source: If a computer starts in recovery mode before the recovery key is stored on the MBAM Server, no recovery method is available, and the computer has to be reimaged.
segment.target: If a computer starts in recovery mode before the recovery key is stored on the MBAM Server, no recovery method is available, and the computer has to be reimaged.

segment.source: Open a command prompt as an administrator, and stop the MBAM service.
segment.target: Open a command prompt as an administrator, and stop the MBAM service.

segment.source: Set the service to Manual or On demand by typing the following commands:
segment.target: Set the service to Manual or On demand by typing the following commands:

segment.source: Set the registry values so that the MBAM Client ignores the Group Policy settings and instead sets encryption to start the time Windows is deployed to that client computer.
segment.target: Set the registry values so that the MBAM Client ignores the Group Policy settings and instead sets encryption to start the time Windows is deployed to that client computer.

segment.source: This step describes how to modify the Windows registry.
segment.target: This step describes how to modify the Windows registry.

segment.source: Using Registry Editor incorrectly can cause serious issues that can require you to reinstall Windows.
segment.target: Using Registry Editor incorrectly can cause serious issues that can require you to reinstall Windows.

segment.source: We cannot guarantee that issues resulting from the incorrect use of Registry Editor can be resolved.
segment.target: We cannot guarantee that issues resulting from the incorrect use of Registry Editor can be resolved.

segment.source: Use Registry Editor at your own risk.
segment.target: Use Registry Editor at your own risk.

segment.source: Set the TPM for Operating system only encryption, run Regedit.exe, and then import the registry key template from C:Program FilesMicrosoftMDOP MBAMMBAMDeploymentKeyTemplate.reg.
segment.target: Set the TPM for Operating system only encryption, run Regedit.exe, and then import the registry key template from C:Program FilesMicrosoftMDOP MBAMMBAMDeploymentKeyTemplate.reg.

segment.source: In Regedit.exe, go to HKLMSOFTWAREMicrosoftMBAM, and configure the settings that are listed in the following table.
segment.target: In Regedit.exe, go to HKLMSOFTWAREMicrosoftMBAM, and configure the settings that are listed in the following table.

segment.source: You can set Group Policy settings or registry values related to MBAM here.
segment.target: You can set Group Policy settings or registry values related to MBAM here.

segment.source: These settings will override previously set values.
segment.target: These settings will override previously set values.

segment.source: 1 = Use deployment time policy settings (default) – use this setting to enable encryption at the time Windows is deployed to the client computer.
segment.target: 1 = Use deployment time policy settings (default) – use this setting to enable encryption at the time Windows is deployed to the client computer.

segment.source: 0 = Do not use key escrow (the next two registry entries are not required in this case)
segment.target: 0 = Do not use key escrow (the next two registry entries are not required in this case)

segment.source: 1 = Use key escrow in Key Recovery system (default)
segment.target: 1 = Use key escrow in Key Recovery system (default)

segment.source: This is the recommended setting, which enables MBAM to store the recovery keys.
segment.target: This is the recommended setting, which enables MBAM to store the recovery keys.

segment.source: The computer must be able to communicate with the MBAM Key Recovery service.
segment.target: The computer must be able to communicate with the MBAM Key Recovery service.

segment.source: Verify that the computer can communicate with the service before you proceed.
segment.target: Verify that the computer can communicate with the service before you proceed.

segment.source: 1 = Uploads Recovery Key and Key Recovery Package (default)
segment.target: 1 = Uploads Recovery Key and Key Recovery Package (default)

segment.source: Set this value to the URL for the server running the Key Recovery service, for example, http://computer name/MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService/CoreService.svc.
segment.target: Set this value to the URL for the server running the Key Recovery service, for example, http://computer name/MBAMRecoveryAndHardwareService/CoreService.svc.

segment.source: The MBAM Client will restart the system during the MBAM Client deployment.
segment.target: The MBAM Client will restart the system during the MBAM Client deployment.

segment.source: When you are ready for this restart, run the following command at a command prompt as an administrator:
segment.target: When you are ready for this restart, run the following command at a command prompt as an administrator:

segment.source: When the computers restarts, and the BIOS prompts you, accept the TPM change.
segment.target: When the computers restarts, and the BIOS prompts you, accept the TPM change.

segment.source: During the Windows client operating system imaging process, when you are ready to start encryption, open a command prompt as an administrator, and type the following commands to set the start to Automatic and to restart the MBAM Client agent:
segment.target: During the Windows client operating system imaging process, when you are ready to start encryption, open a command prompt as an administrator, and type the following commands to set the start to Automatic and to restart the MBAM Client agent:

segment.source: To delete the bypass registry values, run Regedit.exe, and go to the HKLMSOFTWAREMicrosoft registry entry.
segment.target: To delete the bypass registry values, run Regedit.exe, and go to the HKLMSOFTWAREMicrosoft registry entry.

segment.source: Right-click the MBAM node, and then click Delete.
segment.target: Right-click the MBAM node, and then click Delete.
